title: Create GitHub Actions workflow for pull requests
description: Set up a GitHub Actions workflow that runs on pull requests to the default branch. Ensure the workflow installs dependencies, runs linting, executes the test suite, and reports status checks back to GitHub. Coordinate with existing package managers and scripts already defined in the repo.
acceptance_criteria:
- Workflow triggers on pull requests to the default branch
- Dependency installation uses the repo's existing package manager and lockfile
- Lint (`bun run lint`) and test (`bun run test`) steps run as part of the workflow
- Workflow reports pass/fail status checks on GitHub

title: Plan automated release publishing with user-focused changelog
description: Develop a strategy for automating the release publishing process, including generating a user-facing changelog that excludes internal-only notes. Evaluate tooling or workflows that can integrate with the project's existing scripts and lockfiles.
acceptance_criteria:
- Outline the release automation workflow, including triggers and required tooling
- Identify how changelog entries will be generated and curated for user relevance
- Document recommended changes to repository scripts or CI to support the automation
- Provide next steps for implementing the strategy

title: Enhance media handling for responsive embeds
description: Improve media rendering to better align with GitHub. Implement responsive image handling, provide an optional lightbox experience for images, and ensure videos or other embedded content degrade gracefully when unsupported.
acceptance_criteria:
- Images render responsively within the content container, maintaining aspect ratio without overflowing
- Optional image lightbox can be enabled to view images at full size without leaving the page
- Video and other embedded media either render cleanly or display a fallback message when unsupported

title: Add client-side diagram rendering support
description: Introduce support for rendering diagrams commonly used on GitHub, such as Mermaid and PlantUML, within the client. Evaluate libraries that can run in the browser and integrate with the project's rendering pipeline.
acceptance_criteria:
- Mermaid diagrams render correctly in the client output with appropriate theming
- Provide a strategy for supporting PlantUML or document why it is out of scope
- Include safeguards to prevent untrusted diagram content from executing arbitrary code

title: Implement configurable GitHub reference auto-linking
description: Automatically link GitHub issue and pull request mentions (e.g. `#123`, `owner/repo#456`) in rendered content, with support for configuring the default repository context.
acceptance_criteria:
- References of the form `#123` link to the configured repository's issue or PR page
- Cross-repository references (`owner/repo#456`) resolve to the correct GitHub URL
- Provide configuration options to override or disable auto-linking on a per-repository basis
